description.value:
By 5th level, while you have your Alchemist's Satchel within reach, you are able to improve the properties of various potions during a short or long rest. You are able to add potent reagents to a number of potions equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 1), you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest. For more information on creating potions see Chapter 2: Downtime Revisited in Xanathar's Guide to Everything. Potions gain the the following benefits:

  • Potions that grant a benefit for 1 hour or more after drinking, also grant temporary hit points equal to twice your proficiency bonus.
  • Healing potions restore an additional amount of health equal to your proficiency bonus.
  • Adventuring Gear such as Acid (vial) Alchemist's Fire (flask) or Holy Water (flask) (or more at your DM's Discretion) deal additional damage equal to your proficiency bonus.
  • Antitoxin cures the creature of one disease or neutralize one poison affecting it.
